Articles.Content: Very high quality modelling and excellent attention to detail. I'll bookmark this for my future aircraft projects.

> 
> Just my opinion, but a part that shape and size really will be limited by being landing gear. That said the animation looks really good.

Yeah, I'm trying to see how feasible the part will be. I may provide both a landing gear version and a non-landing gear type.

> 
> Very high quality modelling and excellent attention to detail. I'll bookmark this for my future aircraft projects.

Thanks! I watch your videos all the time.

Hmmmm, looks great to test some of my heavy weapons on. Some proper cockpits!  

I'll have to include it in my series and testing, very well done texture and model job!

After hours of self learning and tinkering I have one more cockpit to present.  

Coming soon to a KSP near you. The Falken Drone: SpacePlane Edition!  

[img]http://i.imgur.com/bqp33oH.png?1[/img]

[quote name='martinezfg11']After hours of self learning and tinkering I have one more cockpit to present.  

Coming soon to a KSP near you. The Falken Drone: SpacePlane Edition!  

[/QUOTE]  

great mod and can't wait to use this one too
Delightful! Thank you for the update.

version 1.3 is on KerbalStuff and Kerbal CurseForge.

Please check the OP for changelog.
Just stopping by to say that these parts are pretty neato! I love the KerbinHawk design in particular, great job! I've been on a modding hiatus for a little too long, need to draft some new parts...

![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png ":o") HE LIVES! but seriously good to know you're doing well!  you coudl always continue the Chopper parts you had planned. I was really looking foreward to that you had done and was really excited to see what you could do, anyhow! welcome back and I'm sure the whole community is excited!

> 
> 
> 34 minutes ago, Hellbrand said:
> 
> 
> ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png ":o") HE LIVES! but seriously good to know you're doing well!  you coudl always continue the Chopper parts you had planned. I was really looking foreward to that you had done and was really excited to see what you could do, anyhow! welcome back and I'm sure the whole community is excited!
> 

I do! Yeah I will most likely go back and take a look at those and see if I can finish them up ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") I put too much time into modeling and texturing those rotors not to release them at some point xD. I appreciate the kind words!

I'm doing some art passes on the KU47 cockpit. Remodeled it a bit and re-textured it (again!).

It's it's less stockalike (meh) than the last texture pass. I like it more though.

![Xx0kAA8.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/Xx0kAA8.png?1)

Been doing some modelling and I think this will be my next part..

![oFFaThH.png](http://i.imgur.com/oFFaThH.png)

I'm excited for this one. It's coming out better than I expected.

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/vlnUPTmyyuQ?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2015-12-24T17:16:11Z" title="12/24/2015 05:16  PM" data-short="8 yr">December 24, 2015</time> by martinezfg11**
  
ARGH EMBEDD YT VIDEOS!!

hey, just curious about how much progress you're making on the awesome new engines? also, i know it's a lot to ask, but have you ever thought of making a Mk1 hull version of the cobra cockpit, essentially just chopping the side intakes off? i think it would be really useful for people who like to build using the Mk1 profile.

The engine is being textured, progress is a little slow right now. I also have a mess of configs to fix, I just hacked together a .cfg that will not work for release.

And as for the MK1 profile well... 

![KeYIRuH.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/KeYIRuH.jpg)

Texture is still WIP, I also configured it with an internal vulcan cannon via the BDArmory plugin.

Will it use aset when you release it? Thank you so very much for the lack of integrated intakes there it's a distinct lack if nice mk1 cockpits without intakes. I much prefer the flexibility of placing my own intakes.

The cockpit looks amazing! Gives me nostalgia of Top gun. I can't wait for the new update. Maybe as a Idea, add some Ground attack looking cockpits.

Almost done with the MK22-V engine.

![5uKEqTr.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/5uKEqTr.png?1)
Finally! Now i can make Su-34 Fullback, and Su-25 Frogfoot!
The ASET Avionics (oldstyle gauges) pack is one of my absolute favorite things in KSP. It's a shame more internals don't use them.
